title: CTRL0000916054 - Transcribed Interview of Kenneth Klukowski, (June 10, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held in room 5480, O'Neill House Office
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a resumed deposition of Mr. Ken Klukowski, conducted by the
House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the U.S. Capitol
At this time, Mr. Klukowski, could you please reintroduce yourself?
And, Counsel, first in the room, why don't you introduce yourself.
And we do have counsel joining on the Webex platform
If you could please introduce yourself.
Eddie Greim from Graves Garrett, dialing in from Kansas City,
My name is Kenneth Allen Klukowski.
I'd like to just thank you all for being here in person and
So we have met before, and the same rules are going to govern, but I do want to
go over some of them again just to remind you.
This is going to be a staff-led interview like before.
opportunity to join, and if they do, we'll try to announce their presence so you know that
I'm a senior investigative counsel for the select
And with me in the room today is
Under the House deposition rules, neither committee members nor staff can
discuss the substance of the testimony you provide today unless the committee approves
And you and your attorney will have an opportunity to review the transcript
I understand that you have reviewed the existing transcript from last time.
we'll make that opportunity available for the future transcript from today.
There is an official reporter transcribing the record of the deposition.
wait until each question is completed before you begin your response, and we'll try to
wait until your response is complete before we ask our next question.
the stenographer can't record nonverbal responses, such as shaking your head, so please
do answer with an audible, verbal response.
Like before, we ask that you provide complete answers based on your best
know the answer, please simply say so, but you may only refuse to answer a question to
preserve a privilege recognized by the select committee.
And if the question is not clear, please ask for clarification.
And if you do refuse to answer a question based on a privilege, then staff can
either proceed with the deposition or seek a ruling from the chairman on the objection.
And if the chairman overrules such an objection, you would be required to answer the
I do want to remind you that it's unlawful to deliberately provide false information
And since this deposition is under oath, providing false information could
result in criminal penalties for perjury or providing false statements.
Do you understand all of that that we went over?
At this time, I'd ask that you stand and raise your right hand to be resworn.
Mr. Klukowski, do you swear or affirm under the penalty of
perjury that the testimony you're about to give in this deposition shall be the truth, the
whole truth, and nothing but the truth?
And then, if at any time you need any breaks or
would like to consult with your counsel, please just let us know, we're happy to do so.
And just as a reminder, this is being recorded through the Webex platform and
So if you do need to consult, we'll figure out a way to do that, because
At this point, I understand that either you, Mr. Greim, or you,
Mr. Brothers, would like to make preliminary remarks.
We'd just like to note for the record before we begin the
resumed deposition, at the beginning of this deposition some months ago, Mr. Klukowski
objections include, but aren't limited to, matters dealing with the composition of the
committee, the authorization of the committee to issue a subpoena for Mr. Klukowski's
deposition testimony based on the composition issues, whether the subpoena is
supported by a legislative purpose and a pertinent committee function.
I will not recite them for the record again, but the
There were also numerous objections raised in Mr. Klukowski's document
And we preserve all of those objections and are not waiving any of them by
appearing to resume the deposition today.
And we also continue to preserve all
the record, and simplicity, hopefully, also incorporate, in addition to what you said, the
objections that are reflected in the transcript from December 15th, which is the first time
So this is going to be a more targeted deposition than last time.
There's a few issues we wanted to bring you back to discuss.
The first I'll start with is going back to Mr. Jeffrey Bossert Clark.
understand that you began working for him on December 15th at the Department of
